logic

Class Weapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Weapon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Club

    public class Weapon
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a weapon in the in the game. A weapon can be visible or not. Used by some of the characters.
    Author:
    Jo√£o Vieira, Susana Lima
    See Also:
    Character, Serialized Form

        public void setMove(boolean move)
        Set this Weapon move value.
        Parameters:
        move - the new value of this Weapon move

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(boolean visible)
        Set this Weapon visible value.
        Parameters:
        visible - the new value of this Weapon visible

      • moveUp

        public void moveUp()
        Set this Weapon position to one unit above the current position. Updates values of prevX and prevY to the current position values. Decreases this Weapon Y by a unit (equivalent to moving up).

      • moveDown

        public void moveDown()
        Set this Weapon position to one unit under the current position. Updates values of prevX and prevY to the current position values. Increases this Weapon Y by a unit (equivalent to moving down).

      • moveLeft

        public void moveLeft()
        Set this Weapon position to one unit to the left of the current position. Updates values of prevX and prevY to the current position values. Decreases this Weapon X by a unit (equivalent to moving left).

      • moveRight

        public void moveRight()
        Set this Weapon position to one unit to the right of the current position. Updates values of prevX and prevY to the current position values. Increases this Weapon X by a unit (equivalent to moving right).

      • updatePosition

        public void updatePosition(char command)
        Set this Weapon X and Y values accordingly to the command given. Calls upon this Class move*() functions in order to do that update.
        Parameters:
        command - the char used to update this Weapon position

      • setToPreviousPosition

        public void setToPreviousPosition()
        Set this Weapon X and Y values to prevX and prevY respectively. Places Weapon in the previous position.

      • reverseCommand

        public char reverseCommand(char command)
        Given a specific command, it return the calculated command that can move this Weapon in the opposite direction
        Parameters:
        command - the char to be used as reference to move this Weapon in the opposite direction
        Returns:
        the calculated opposite command

      • isHit

        public boolean isHit(Character c)
        Checks if this Weapon and character c are in hitting proximity (distance minor or equal to one unit).
        Parameters:
        c - the Character with which the proximity is checked
        Returns:
        true if in hitting proximity, else false
